An "independent innovator" is defined as a person or entity obtaining a method of use patent for a biological product, not affiliated with the holder of a marketing application approved under section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act. The term "affiliated" in the context of a marketing application approved under section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act refers to any relationship of employment, control, or common ownership, whether direct or indirect. A "qualified small business" is defined as any entity with fewer than 500 employees.
